list.name: Changes
list.comment: Implemented Laptop class, which extends the DesktopPC class. The Laptop class introduces an additional property, screenSize, which represents the size of the laptop's screen. It provides a constructor to initialize this property along with the inherited properties from the DesktopPC class. Additionally, it includes getter and setter methods for the screenSize property.

task.summary: Added the text file that I will need to use in my program.

- Added 5 more classes. DatabaseFileReader: reads in the database file. DesktopPC: child class of the device parent class, and holds information specific to Desktop Pc's including memory size and SSD. Laptop: a child class of the DesktopPC parent class, and holds information specific to laptops including screen size. Tablet: a child class of the device parent class, and holds information specific to tablets including screen size. Device: This class is parent class. It is the parent class of Tablet, Desktop PC and Laptop, and it holds the information relevant to these three different types of computer including its category, type, ID, brand, CPU and price.
- Added three more classes: Users, ComputerTable and LoginDialogScreen.
- Added TheComputerStore.png file for the image of the computer store logo. - Added LoginScreen class that takes care of the initial login screen.
Added ComputerTable class with JTabbedPane, ArrayLists, and JFrame.
Implement ComputerTableModel with device list and table functionality.
Read and populate device data from file in DatabaseFileReader.

Implemented DesktopPC class which extends the Device class. The DesktopPC class introduces additional properties such as memorySize and SSD (solid-state drive). It provides a constructor to initialize these properties along with the inherited properties from the Device class. Additionally, it includes getter and setter methods for memorySize and SSD.

Implemented Device class. The Device class contains properties such as category, type, ID, brand, CPU, and price. It provides a constructor to initialize these properties. Additionally, it includes setter and getter methods for each property, allowing access and modification of the device's attributes.

Implemented Laptop class, which extends the DesktopPC class. The Laptop class introduces an additional property, screenSize, which represents the size of the laptop's screen. It provides a constructor to initialize this property along with the inherited properties from the DesktopPC class. Additionally, it includes getter and setter methods for the screenSize property.
